Key Match Events: De'Aaron Fox recorded 33 points, six rebounds and six assists
Domantas Sabonis added 17 points, 16 rebounds and seven assists
Malik Monk registered 14 points, seven boards and six assists
Trey Lyles and DeMar DeRozan each added 14 points
The Kings outscored Dallas 54-40 in the second half
Pre-Game Insights: The Sacramento Kings snapped a season-worst six-game losing streak
Interim coach Doug Christie got his first win
Post-Match Reflections: Spencer Dinwiddie scored a season-best 30 points
P.J. Washington had a season-high 28 points for the Mavericks
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sacramento held a commanding 58-36 rebounding advantage
Daniel Gafford swatted away five blocked shots
Quentin Grimes added 11 points and seven rebounds
Brandon Williams scored 10 points for the Mavericks
Others: The Mavericks led 75-66 after a basket by Grimes with 4:56 left in the third quarter
The Kings ripped off a 17-2 surge to end the period
Dallas crept within 102-93 on a 3-pointer by Grimes with 3:21 to play
